channel.title: [317] [Delta] Log out timer help? [317] [Delta]
channel.description:
hey guys, my log out timer isnt long enough.
when a player is AFK it logs them out in like 30 seconds.
How do i change the log out timer length?

item.title: [317] [Delta] Log out timer help? [317] [Delta]
item.dc:creator: @mc_wobbla mc wobbla
item.description:
@mc_wobbla wrote:

[quote=“the king erik, post:8, topic:400797”]well first open your clent.java(server-sided)
and search for [size=12pt]logout();[/size]
and you should see something like this
case 202: // idle logout packet if(!inCombat) logout(); break;
now you just delete the logout();
hope i could help you =)[/quote]

thats peeerfect. thanks

Read full topic

item.title: [317] [Delta] Log out timer help? [317] [Delta]
item.dc:creator: @the_king_erik the king erik
item.description:
@the_king_erik wrote:

well first open your clent.java(server-sided)
and search for [size=12pt]logout();[/size]
and you should see something like this
case 202: // idle logout packet if(!inCombat) logout(); break;
now you just delete the logout();
hope i could help you =)

Read full topic

item.title: [317] [Delta] Log out timer help? [317] [Delta]
item.dc:creator: @halflive9 halflive9
item.description:
@halflive9 wrote:

Is it exactly 30 seconds? Well then u should zfilesearcher or someting and search for 30.

item.title: [317] [Delta] Log out timer help? [317] [Delta]
item.dc:creator: @mrpopyman mrpopyman
item.description:
@mrpopyman wrote:

[quote=“Coelho, post:5, topic:400797”][quote author=mrpopyman link=topic=497853.msg3640822#msg3640822 date=1308988248]

This is client-side (if you want to change the length of the time)

Otherwise, you can delete it entirely by going to where you parse packets and using CTRL-F on your server

ok, i want to delete it entirely, how do i do this?

Plz explain how to in step by step detail

Yes, i know, i need to be spoonfed LOL
[/quote]

Step 1: CTRL - F

Step 2: Activate your brain[/quote]

plz someone help!

Read full topic

Otherwise, you can delete it entirely by going to where you parse packets and using CTRL-F on your server
[/quote]

ok, i want to delete it entirely, how do i do this?

Plz explain how to in step by step detail

Yes, i know, i need to be spoonfed LOL[/quote]

Step 1: CTRL - F

Step 2: Activate your brain
